keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up' at the airport.
Cagle was not armed when arrested, but police discovered an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle parked outside the airport.

Cagle faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assaults, possession of a firearm in commission of a felony, and being a convicted felon in possession of a firearm.

He is also charged with federal offenses: attempted violence at an international airport, interstate communications containing threats to injure, and being a convicted felon in possession of a firearm.
Cagle previously was convicted of marijuana possession over two decades ago and has a history of being a convicted felon.
The incident took place at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, the world’s busiest airport, which serves as a major transportation hub and is central to Delta Air Lines operations.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and authorities emphasized that the incident was averted due to early intervention by Cagle’s family and police coordination.
Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens noted that the combination of a semi-automatic weapon and mental challenges could have been deadly.
Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem commended law enforcement for preventing a potential tragedy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport, the world’s busiest airport, after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up' at the facility. Although he was not armed when arrested, police discovered an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle. Cagle faces multiple state and federal charges, including terroristic threats, attempted aggravated assaults, and being a convicted felon in possession of a firearm. Authorities credit the incident being averted due to early intervention by Cagle’s family and inter-agency cooperation between Cartersville and Atlanta police. The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and officials, including Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens and Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, emphasized the potential dangers of combining mental health issues with access to weapons. This event highlights public safety concerns at major transportation hubs and the importance of community vigilance and law enforcement coordination.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to ‘Shoot It Up’
